de.mrapp.android.adapter.expandablelist.enablestate

Interface EnableStateExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>

  • Type Parameters:
    GroupType - The type of the underlying data of the adapter's group items
    ChildType - The type of the underlying data of the adapter's child items
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>, MultipleChoiceExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>, NoChoiceExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>, SelectableExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>, SingleChoiceExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractEnableStateExpandableListAdapter, AbstractExpandableListAdapter, AbstractFilterableExpandableListAdapter, AbstractItemStateExpandableListAdapter, AbstractSelectableExpandableListAdapter, AbstractSortableExpandableListAdapter, ExpandableListAdapterImplementation, MultipleChoiceExpandableListAdapterImplementation, SingleChoiceExpandableListAdapterImplementation

    public interface EnableStateExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>
    Defines the interface, an adapter, whose underlying data is managed as a list of arbitrary group and child items, which may be enabled or disabled, must implement. Such an adapter's purpose is to provide the underlying data for visualization using an ExpandableListView widget.
    Since:
    0.1.0

    • Method Detail

      • isGroupEnabled

        boolean isGroupEnabled(int groupIndex)
        Returns, whether the group item, which belongs to a specific index, is currently enabled, or not.
        Parameters:
        groupIndex - The index of the group item, whose enable state should be checked, as an Integer value. The index must be between 0 and the value of the method getGroupCount():int - 1, otherwise an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown
        Returns:
        True, if the group item, which belongs to the given index, is currently enabled, false otherwise

      • isGroupEnabled

        boolean isGroupEnabled(@NonNull
                       GroupType group)
        Returns, whether a specific group item is currently enabled, or not.
        Parameters:
        group - The group item, whose enable state should be checked, as an instance of the generic type GroupType. The group item may not be null. If the group item does not belong to the adapter, a NoSuchElementException will be thrown
        Returns:
        True, if the given group item is currently enabled, false otherwise

      • setGroupEnabled

        void setGroupEnabled(int groupIndex,
                     boolean enabled)
        Sets the enable state of the group item, which belongs to a specific index.
        Parameters:
        groupIndex - The index of the group item, whose enable state should be set, as an Integer value. The index must be between 0 and the value of the method getGroupCount():int - 1, otherwise an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown
        enabled - True, if the group item, which belongs to the given index, should be enabled, false otherwise

      • setGroupEnabled

        void setGroupEnabled(@NonNull
                     GroupType group,
                     boolean enabled)
        Sets the enable state of a specific group item.
        Parameters:
        group - The group item, which should be enabled, as an instance of the generic type GroupType. The group item may not be null. If the group item does not belong to the adapter, a NoSuchElementException will be thrown
        enabled - True, if the given group item should be enabled, false otherwise

      • triggerGroupEnableState

        boolean triggerGroupEnableState(int groupIndex)
        Triggers the enable state of the group item, which belongs to a specific index. This causes the group item to become disabled, if it is currently enabled and vice versa.
        Parameters:
        groupIndex - The index of the group item, whose enable state should be triggered, as an Integer value. The index must be between 0 and the value of the method getGroupCount():int - 1, otherwise an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown
        Returns:
        True, if the group item has been enabled, false, if the group item has been disabled

      • triggerGroupEnableState

        boolean triggerGroupEnableState(boolean triggerChildStates,
                                int groupIndex)
        Triggers the enable state of the group item, which belongs to a specific index. This causes the group item to become disabled, if it is currently enabled and vice versa.
        Parameters:
        triggerChildStates - True, if the enable states of the group item's children should also be triggered, false otherwise
        groupIndex - The index of the group item, whose enable state should be triggered, as an Integer value. The index must be between 0 and the value of the method getGroupCount():int - 1, otherwise an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown
        Returns:
        True, if the group item has been enabled, false, if the group item has been disabled

      • triggerGroupEnableState

        boolean triggerGroupEnableState(@NonNull
                                GroupType group)
        Triggers the enable state of a specific group item. This causes the group item to become disabled, if it is currently enabled and vice versa.
        Parameters:
        group - The group item, whose enable state should be triggered, as an instance of the generic type GroupType. The group item may not be null. If the group item does not belong to the adapter, a NoSuchElementException will be thrown
        Returns:
        True, if the group item has been enabled, false, if the group item has been disabled

      • triggerGroupEnableState

        boolean triggerGroupEnableState(boolean triggerChildStates,
                                @NonNull
                                GroupType group)
        Triggers the enable state of a specific group item. This causes the group item to become disabled, if it is currently enabled and vice versa.
        Parameters:
        triggerChildStates - True, if the enable states of the group item's children should also be triggered, false otherwise
        group - The group item, whose enable state should be triggered, as an instance of the generic type GroupType. The group item may not be null. If the group item does not belong to the adapter, a NoSuchElementException will be thrown
        Returns:
        True, if the group item has been enabled, false, if the group item has been disabled

      • setAllGroupsEnabled

        void setAllGroupsEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Sets the enable states of all group items.
        Parameters:
        enabled - True, if all group items should be enabled, false otherwise

      • triggerAllGroupEnableStates

        void triggerAllGroupEnableStates()
        Triggers the enable states of all group items. This causes a group item to become disabled, if it is currently enabled and vice versa.

      • triggerAllGroupEnableStates

        void triggerAllGroupEnableStates(boolean triggerChildStates)
        Triggers the enable states of all group items. This causes a group item to become disabled, if it is currently enabled and vice versa.
        Parameters:
        triggerChildStates - True, if the enable states of the group items' children should be also triggered, false otherwise

      • isChildEnabled

        boolean isChildEnabled(@NonNull
                       GroupType group,
                       int childIndex)
        Returns, whether the child item, which belongs to a specific index of a specific group, is currently enabled, or not.
        Parameters:
        group - The group, the child item, whose enable state should be checked, belongs to, as an instance of the generic type GroupType. The group may not be null. If the group does not belong to the adapter, a NoSuchElementException will be thrown
        childIndex - The index of the child item, whose enable state should be checked, as an Integer value. The index must be between 0 and the value of the method getChildCount(group):int - 1, otherwise an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown
        Returns:
        True, if the child item, which belongs to the given index, is currently enabled, false otherwise

      • triggerChildEnableState

        boolean triggerChildEnableState(@NonNull
                                GroupType group,
                                int childIndex)
        Triggers the enable state of the child item, which belongs to a specific index of a specific group. This causes the child item to become disabled, if it is currently enabled and vice versa.
        Parameters:
        group - The group, the child item, whose enable state should be triggered, belongs to, as an instance of the generic type GroupType. The group may not be null. If the group does not belong to the adapter, a NoSuchElementException will be thrown
        childIndex - The index of the child item, whose enable state should be triggered, as an Integer value. The index must be between 0 and the value of the method getChildCount(group):int - 1, otherwise an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown
        Returns:
        True, if the child item has been enabled, false, if the child item has been disabled
